name: 楊元森
objective:
The use of probability models and statistical methods for analyzing data has become common practice in virtually all scientific disciplines. This course attemps to provide a brief introduction to those models and methods most likely to be encountered and used by students in their careers in engineering and sciences.
The exposition is relatively modest in terms of mathematical development. Substantial use of the calculus is required in this course.
This course also introduces general sciences through documentaries. Statistics and probability parts in documentaries will be extracted and discussed by students.
schedule:
Week  1:     Overview and Descriptive Statistics
Weeks 2-3:   Probability
Weeks 4-5:   Discrete Random Variables and Probability Distributions
Weeks 6-7:   Continuous Random Variables and Probability Distributions
Week 8:      Midterm simulation
Week 9:      Midterm
Weeks 10-11: Joint Probability Distributions and Random Samples
Weeks 12-13: Point Estimation
Weeks 14-15: Statistical Intervals Based on a Single Sample
Week  16:    Final simulation
Week  17:    Final
Week  18:    V-learning
